How can I list all available currencies on the Verus network, and what are some ways to do it?

To list all available currencies on the Verus network, you can use the `listcurrencies` command. This command can be used in two ways: through the Verus command-line interface (CLI) or through the Verus JSON-RPC API.

**Using the Verus CLI:**
To list all available currencies using the Verus CLI, you can simply run the following command:
```
verus listcurrencies true
```
This command will return a list of all available currencies on the Verus network.

**Using the Verus JSON-RPC API:**
To list all available currencies using the Verus JSON-RPC API, you can send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus daemon. Here's an example of how to do it using the `curl` command:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listcurrencies", "params": [true] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This command sends a JSON-RPC request to the Verus daemon, which will return a list of all available currencies on the Verus network.

In both cases, the `true` parameter specifies that you want to list all available currencies, including those that are not enabled by default.

By using the `listcurrencies` command, you can easily discover and explore the various currencies available on the Verus network, and take advantage of the platform's flexibility and customizability.

Examples:
> verus listcurrencies true
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listcurrencies", "params": [true] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
